Welcome to the California Community Colleges Chancellor's Office

The California Community Colleges is the largest system of higher education in the nation, with 2.1 million students attending 112 colleges. Our colleges provide students with the knowledge and background necessary to compete in today’s economy. With a wide range of educational offerings, the colleges provide workforce training, basic courses in English and math, certificate and degree programs and preparation for transfer to four-year institutions.

Our Mission

The mission of the California Community Colleges Board of Governors and the Chancellor's Office is to empower the community colleges through leadership, advocacy and support.

Initiative

Veterans Summit IV
The California Community Colleges Chancellor’s Office, Faculty Association for California Community Colleges and the Foundation for California Community Colleges are partnering to host the California Community Colleges Veterans Summit IV Dec. 4-5, 2014 at the San Jose Marriott Hotel. The summit is designed to share information and best practices for faculty, administrators and staff who work with student veterans on our campuses. For more information, please visit, www.veteranssummit.org
 

Chancellor's Office System Operations
The Chancellor’s Office has nine divisions and each is led by a vice chancellor, performing vital tasks to keep the Chancellor’s Office running smoothly.

  • Academic Affairs

  • Technology & Research

  • Campus Safety

Research & Analysis
Datamart
Datamart answers the questions posed by administrators, educators, parents, students, state leadership, and professional organizations by providing information on students, courses, student services, outcomes and faculty and staff.
  • Demographics
  • Courses Characteristics
  • Student Services data
  • Student Outcomes
  • Faculty & Staff.

Reports & Resources
The California Community Colleges Chancellor's Office provides various reports throughout the year to the Governor's Office and legislature. These reports provide information on various key functions within the system.

To read the current and archived reports, visit our Reports & Resources section.
